verb.description: Deliver a sermon or religious address to an assembled group of people, typically in church.
examples: he preached to a large congregation
our pastor will preach the sermon

phrases: Tell any mother who is either working or wants to get back into paid work after having a child that it is difficult finding affordable childcare, and you are already preaching to the converted.
You're preaching to the converted over here, my friend.
The problem is more than just preaching to the converted.
Thursday's summit attracted an audience of around 100 young farmers and industry insiders and it was a case of preaching to the converted for many delegates.
I guess we're sort of preaching to the converted already.
origin: Middle English: from Old French prechier, from Latin praedicare proclaim, in ecclesiastical Latin preach, from prae before + dicare declare.
